crypto.name: AESthetic challenge
crypto.desc: "I have got these two creepy audio files. I guess they have something to tell us. What could be the message?"

crypto.name: Can you Break the KEY
crypto.desc: In the Cryptic Realm of hexadecimal whispers, where the key to unlocking secrets is entwined within the digital range, we embark on the journey guided by the silent vigil of numbers to unveil the hidden cipher.

crypto.name: Cipher Conundrum
crypto.desc: Can you find what's going on!!!!!!!

crypto.name: DiffieRivestHellmanCipher
crypto.desc: Ever wondered how secret key exchange takes place?

crypto.name: Echoes of Encryption
crypto.desc:
In December 2022, my friend Alok's device was hacked. Upon investigation, he discovered that the breach was due to a vulnerability in the Nvidia SMC which had been recently discovered and published for research purposes on the same day he was hacked.

PS- In the end, only numbers matter to grow a plant from a seed!!

crypto.name: I Know Music
crypto.desc: I got the chords and the capo. omw to play wonderwall.

crypto.name: Rivest Salted Adleman
crypto.desc: "Bob told me original q was eksored with some secret value 1 2 9 or 1 thru 9 something like that.... ughhh I am so confused...."

forensic.name: BIBBA 1
forensic.desc: my grandfather sent me this one photo describing it as his one of the most cherised and sacred memories during his time. help me find out some details about it. part 1: png header error, after solving flag would be printed on the photo.

forensic.name: Bluetooth For The Win
forensic.desc:
Mr. Jaap Haartsen once told me that he used to have his secret mode of transmission through a technology he invented. There is a saying that he still have one message that no one could ever decrypt. I still have that file and I challenge you to retrieve that message.
PS: Mind that this guy used to FIDGET a lottt!

forensic.name: Check Research and Check again
forensic.desc: Sometimes in life, everything goes wrong, nothing works and you crash every time you try to look within yourself. In such moments, calculate where you came from, and see what you can correct, generally the last thing you did wrong is what needs to be corrected first.

forensic.name: Lost My Keyboard
forensic.desc: Spilled some coffee onto my keyboard

forensic.name: The Vanishing of Dr. Kumar
forensic.desc: Dr. Kumar disappeared right before his big cybersecurity speech, leaving everyone baffled. Despite tight security, no one saw where he went. The mystery of his disappearance has everyone on edge, with ACP Pradyuman and his team joining the investigation.

osint.desc:
OSINT

In a house where whispers softly sound, Eleven hearts in mysteries are bound. Symbols dance in shadows, secrets they hold, Their fate, a tale yet to unfold.

Seeker, in this puzzle's glow, What's on the ground floor, do you know? Amidst this mystery, one thing is clear, What's there now, let's bring it near.

osint.name: Dawg
osint.desc:
OSINT

Thats not a dog, thats a dawg, but who does it belong to?

rev.name: Are You Worthy
rev.desc: The game shall judge your worthiness, delve deep into the depths of this lazy incomplete and unfinished and unpolished game, and seek the truth you seek.

rev.name: GetYourOwnFlag
rev.desc: I am leaning hard into the art theme for all of my challenges.

rev.name: One Liner
rev.desc:
I love shortcuts

flag = "ƃŰŶŉůļźŞŷŭŪƄŰŘŰŧŖŔŦĦŨĬƀźōşŋůĲňĳźĖőƃũťũŸŪĞ"
flag = [~(c^i)*(-int(1/(5**0.5) * ((1 + 5**0.5)**1 / 2 - (1 - 5**0.5)**1 / 2))) + len(flag) * 6 + 15 for i, c in enumerate([ord(a) for a in flag[::-int(1/(5**0.5) * ((1 + 5**0.5)**1 / 2 - (1 - 5**0.5)**1 / 2))]])]
print(tostr(flag))

#  0CTF{___R___E__D___A___C____T_____E____D______}

rev.name: Simplistic Image Format
rev.desc: Some prefer jpg, some prefer png, I prefer hating myself and spending 2 days on making my own image format.

web.name: Pyception
web.desc: My friend loved making lame ahh dad jokes. so I made a website for him where I rated how lame his Dad jokes quotes were. Try it out

web.name: Remedy ChEck
web.desc:
In the world of cyberspace, Remedy-ChEck stands as a bunker of secrets. With only a few lines of code, any smart ahh bastard can uncover its mysteries. With skills and patience, he can break through its walls and win. Will you do the same? The battle is yours.

ps. the flag is located at /flag
